intro: Fumaria agraria var. algerica, commonly known as Algerian celandine, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fumariaceae. It is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters, often appearing in late spring to early summer. The plant has slender, branched stems and alternate, lance-shaped leaves that are typically hairy. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Algerian celandine is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
